[b][color=white]Bytes for Regular Members[/color][/b]
September 14th, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#9999FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] announced regular (unupgraded) members are now able to earn Bytes by posting and making threads, just like upgraded users. This was most likely done to give unupgraded users more incentive to post, in order to get Bytes and join in on that part of Hack Forums. [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#9999FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] did mention that in the future we may get differential earnings, based on usergroups.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5884751] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

Â  

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3322334][img]https://i.imgur.com/j0jX3Yy.png[/img][/url][/align]
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=medium]

[b][color=white]Research Into HIV Yields Interesting [/color][/b]
The University of Zurich found that around one percent or less of people diagnosed with HIV are able to produce antibodies to completely fight off the disease. This discovery is the result of years of work on the behalf of the Swiss team. They are now focusing their efforts on narrowing and isolating the factors associated with this phenomenon. These antibodies are also now in the process of being studied. The team is well aware this is only the beginning, â€œWe have found one candidate. Based on that, we now want to begin developing an immunogen ourselves,â€ said the author of the paper Prof. Alexandra Trkola, PhD. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.media.uzh.ch/en/Press-Releases/2018/HIV-Vaccine.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Nostalgia and bad Weather[/color][/b] 
New research posits that bad weather may make us feel good. This would be because of the fond memories we have associated with the rain other conditions. Â We all have one or two good memories from our youth surrounding the rain, the brain seems to selectively call back to those. These findings will mostly be applicable in many forms of therapy that require the patient to be entirely relaxed. You may find simulated rain being applied sooner than you think. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.psychologytoday.com/intl/blog/attitude-check/201809/can-bad-weather-make-us-feel-nostalgic-0]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

 Â  
[/size][/font]
[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3322334][img]https://i.imgur.com/Klr96NM.png[/img][/url][/align]
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=medium]

[b][color=white]The Oppressiveness of the China may be Getting to Google[/color][/b] 
A senior scientist has left Google in the wake of their proposal of a censored version of the service for Chinese consumers. The employee is believed one of five others that have left in the wake of this program. Operation Dragonfly, as it was called internally has yet to be spoken about publicly by Google. Those standing firm against the alleged program firmly believes they would be doing a grave disservice to the Chinese public by working on anything resembling a censored version of the engine. I will eagerly be waiting to hear any sort of official response on these events. Â [i][size=x-small][url=https://theintercept.com/2018/09/13/google-china-search-engine-employee-resigns/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]UK Surveliance Program is in hot Water[/color][/b] 
The program has been found to violate human rights by the European Court of Human Rights, citing there were practically zero safeguards in place. They are also referencing how practically no information about the program was ever disclosed to the public. The director of Big Brother Watch, Silkie Carlo, had this to say about the proceedings â€œThis landmark judgment confirming that the UKâ€™s mass spying breached fundamental rights vindicates Mr Snowdenâ€™s courageous whistleblowing and the tireless work of Big Brother Watch and others in our pursuit for justice. Under the guise of counter-terrorism, the UK has adopted the most authoritarian surveillance regime of any Western state, corroding democracy itself and the rights of the British public. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/uk-mass-surveillance-gchq-eu-human-rights-echr-edward-snowden-a8535571.html?utm_source=reddit.com]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

 Â  Â  Â 
[/size][/font]
[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/Tyk8rsw.png[/img][/align]
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=medium]

[b][color=white]Black Ops 4 Blackout Beta Out Now[/color][/b] 
The game was first released to PlayStation 4 players earlier this week, but now it's available for Xbox One and PC players who have pre-ordered the game. The beta will last from September 14 until September 17. If you're on PC and haven't pre-ordered the game yet, there is an open beta scheduled for September 15. This is Call Of Duty's first battle royale game release, rivaling its competitors, Fortnite and PUBG. Although not yet confirmed by Activision, Call Of Duty Black Ops 4 Blackout is rumored to release as a full game on October 12, 2018. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-duty-black-ops-4-blackout-beta-is-live-on-/1100-6461783/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Nintendo Switch Online Service Launch[/color][/b] 
The day is finally upon us, the Nintendo Switch's online service is set to launch on September 18, 2018. Upon its release, users will be able to navigate to the Switch store to download a seven day trial before actually purchasing a paid subscription. Many games will soon be introducing online access following this launch; a few notable titles worth mentioning are [i]Splatoon 2[/i], [i]Arms[/i], and [i]Mario Kart 8 Deluxe[/i]. Purchasing an online subscription will come with benefits such as access to online 20 online NES games, such as the classic [i]The Legend of Zelda[/i]. Prices for the online subscriptions will start at $3.99 per month, $7.99 for the three month bundle, or $19.99 for a year. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theverge.com/2018/9/12/17850516/nintendo-switch-online-service-release-date]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Assassin's Creed III Remastered[/color][/b] 
Ubisoft has announced a remastered Assassin's Creed III release information. For all you fans of Ubisoft's Assassin's Creed franchise, you know the importance of this game - the start of the Kenway Family saga. There are two ways to go about purchasing Assassin's Creed III: Remastered, by purchasing the game as a standalone title or it will be included when purchasing the season pass for Assassin's Creed Odyssey. Purchasing the Odyssey's season pass will also include the HD remaster of Assassin's Creed III: Liberation, along with some story add-ons. The remastered game is scheduled to launch for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC in March 2019. Â [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/were-finally-getting-assassins-creed-3-remastered/1100-6461751/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

 Â  Â  Â  
[/size][/font]
